what is different between sudo get-apt, add/remove in menu, synaptic in system menu ???
- synaptic is just a GUI front end for apt
- if you want to keep better track of dependencies, i suggest reading up on aptitude

- dependencies are files that a program needs in order to run properly - when you use an installer it will link these dependencies for you, but different installers (apt-get vs. aptitude for example) will do it differently  - from what i read aptitude is better with this as well as being a lot smoother on the user
- yes and it should come with your distro
- how big is your internal drive?
- you don't want to cramp things up for virtual memory on the boot drive
- lol yeah i wouldn't worry about 4GB then, unless you are running a missile trajectory program lolol
- you should be fine with how you have it set up - but you could easily save a couple gigs of space  by resizing you swap partition - if it's worth you time lol
